newsitem.title: PERU: Peru wants Amazon litterbugs caught on film.
newsitem.headline: Peru wants Amazon litterbugs caught on film.

text.p: Peruvian authorities have called on citizens in the Amazon jungle to stalk a new prey: litterbugs.

Councilmen have announced a competition offering to reward photographers up to $12 for every photograph that catches townspeople dropping trash in the jungle region of Iquitos, local media reported on Thursday.
The 80 competitors who have so far registered with the council to spy on their neighbours must accompany their incriminating evidence with the name and address of offenders.
In an earlier attempt to clean up the jungle, the army placed the whole town of Pucallpa under curfew until its untidy citizens cleared up their yards.
